name: Agamemnon
title: Greek - Agamemnon
role: King of Mycenae, Commander of the Greek Expedition, Wide-Ruling Lord
summary: Agamemnon, King of Men, led the Greek expedition against Troy as supreme commander. Son of Atreus and brother of Menelaus, his quarrel with Achilles over the war-prize Briseis sets the Iliad's plot in motion. Though powerful and wealthy, Homer portrays him as often foolish and arrogant, sacrificing his daughter Iphigenia for favorable winds and returning home only to be murdered by his wife Clytemnestra.
description: Agamemnon, wide-ruling King of Mycenae and son of Atreus, commands the Greek forces at Troy. His demand for Achilles' war-prize Briseis ignites the wrath that drives Homer's Iliad. Though 'king of men,' Homer portrays him as prone to error, from sacrificing Iphigenia to dishonoring Achilles.
symbols: The curse of the House of Atreus

homeric_context.role_in_epic: Supreme commander whose quarrel with Achilles drives the plot
key_books: Book 2 - Tests the army, Catalogue of Ships
character_flaws: Takes Briseis from Achilles, sparking his wrath
Tests army with false retreat that nearly becomes real

quests: Led the Greek expedition against Troy
Commanded the largest fleet in the Greek armada
Sacrificed Iphigenia at Aulis for favorable winds
Sought to appease Achilles after their quarrel
feats: United the Greek kings against Troy
Led the Greek forces for ten years of war
Had his aristeia in Iliad Book 11
Owned the scepter of kingship forged by Hephaestus
companions: Menelaus (brother, whose wife Helen was taken)

wife: Clytemnestra - who murdered him upon his return from Troy
brother: Menelaus (King of Sparta, whose wife Helen was taken)

house_of_atreus.description: The cursed lineage descending from Tantalus, marked by murder, cannibalism, and betrayal
house_of_atreus.curse_origin: Tantalus served his son Pelops to the gods
family_crimes: Atreus served Thyestes his own children
